snippet: The French foreign minister responded after a partly state-owned telecommunications company said it would seek to withdraw from the Israeli market.
abstract: French Foreign Min Laurent Fabius says his government is firmly opposed to boycott of Israel after Orange, French telecommunications company that is partly state-owned, stated its intention to withdraw its brand from country; Orange chief executive Stephane Richard denies that withdrawal is related to so-called boycott, divestment and sanctions movement and says move is purely business decision.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Alissa J. Rubin from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The French foreign minister responded after a partly state-owned telecommunications company said it would seek to withdraw from the Israeli market.

headline.main: France Says It Opposes Boycotting Israel
headline.print_headline: France Says It Opposes Israel Boycott
